intro: Alsodeia dentata, commonly known as the toothed alsike, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually pink or violet, and it produces small, bean-like pods that contain several seeds. Alsodeia dentata is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil.
